name: Oxalis lourteigiana
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.529.1.11 The specific epithet honours Alicia Lourteig (1913–2003), an Argentinian botanist whose life was partially dedicated to the study of Oxalis.

name: Oxalis megapotamica
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil, Southern America)

name: Oxalis occulta
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364424X17110456120758 Etymology: 'The name Oxalis occulta refers to the fact that this species has been collected since the 1970s, but was kept 'hidden' (occultus, in latin) under Oxalis alata Mart. ex Zucc.'.

name: Oxalis sciophila
distribution: Espírito Santo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
